meanings.definition: The quality or state of being worn or faded in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The shabbiness of the old chair was evident with its torn fabric and creaky frame.
meanings.sent2: The shabbiness of the building made it clear that it needed a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: Despite its shabbiness, the cozy little cottage had a welcoming charm.
meanings.sent4: The shabbiness of the town reflected the hardships its residents had endured.
meanings.sent5: The shabbiness of the dress was a stark reminder of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: A feeling of neglect or disrepair.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't ignore the shabbiness of the abandoned house at the end of the street.
meanings.sent2: The shabbiness of the playground saddened the children who used to play there.
meanings.sent3: The shabbiness of the old toy brought a sense of nostalgia to the room.
meanings.sent4: The shabbiness of the neglected garden mirrored the owner's forgotten dreams.
meanings.sent5: The shabbiness of the forgotten book spoke volumes about its unread pages.

meanings.definition: A lack of elegance or style.
meanings.sent1: The shabbiness of the outfit was evident with its mismatched colors and frayed edges.
meanings.sent2: Despite the shabbiness of the room, it had a cozy and lived-in feel.
meanings.sent3: The shabbiness of the cake didn't affect its delicious taste.
meanings.sent4: Her shabbiness in conversation made her endearing to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The shabbiness of the painting gave it a raw and authentic appeal.
